verbose_text: The results show that N-(3- (aminomethyl) benzyl) acetamidine (1400W) or aminoguanidine (AG) significantly reduced the production of NO from BV2 cells induced by neurons from 5-month-old P301S mice (XREF_FIG; 1400W, p < 0.05; AG, p < 0.001) and that both compounds inhibited the loss of tau + neurons (XREF_FIG; 1400W, p < 0.05; AG, p < 0.01).
